CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Alex Laboratory?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Alex Laboratory is arc {Royal Academy}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Alex Laboratory?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Alex Laboratory is arc {Jessicatown School}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Jessicatown School} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Alex Laboratory} has the largest input flow.

EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between NIT and Royal Academy is {11}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between NIT and Herman Research Center in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from NIT?
SC.A: The total flow output from NIT is {18}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Herman Research Center?

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 33? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {86} from {Jessicatown School} to {Alex Laboratory}, a flow of {40} from {Alex Laboratory} to {Jessicatown School}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 7? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {6} from {Herman Research Center} to {NIT}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 10 and 12? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {11} from {NIT} to {Royal Academy}, a flow of {10} from {Royal Academy} to {NIT}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Royal Academy to NIT or from Herman Research Center to NIT?
NC.A: The flow from {Royal Academy} to {NIT} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Royal Academy to NIT, from Herman Research Center to NIT, or from NIT to Herman Research Center?
NC.A: The flow from {Royal Academy} to {NIT} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Jessicatown School}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Alex Laboratory} and {Jessicatown School}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc NIT, Arc Royal Academy, Arc Jessicatown School, Arc Alex Laboratory, Arc Herman Research Center}.
